title: What situation is best to pick Ashe into?

replies.body: Highly underrated tbh I give her so much %%%% but I have a 90% win rate in normals or something might take her into ranked this season A good Ashe can be better then other ADC because a good Ashe will stun/slow 2-3 people in a teamfight and then kill the ones who try to run cuz permaslows op.

> [{quoted}](name=XSirCution,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=dnTP3BX1,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-16T03:44:19.711+0000)
>
> in ranked i mean

Never, she isn't a good adc.

To be honest she needs a rework because a champion as stagnant as her really doesn't stand a chance. With the new meta being as assassin orientated as it is, ADC's really need a way to escape to allow their front liners to peel off some of the damage.
Once she has some sort of dash or placement ability I think her kit could actually become quite interesting.

Ashe is the most simple adc and is the learning champ for most players new to League. Through her kit, noobs learn essential skills like kiting and the power of crits and vision. Most of the 450 champs are designed to be easy enough to learn, but not op enough to be super viable in high elos.

> [{quoted}](name=yaiamone,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=dnTP3BX1,comment-id=00020002,timestamp=2015-01-16T05:06:13.613+0000)

> Ashe is the most simple adc and is the learning champ for most players new to League. Through her kit, noobs learn essential skills like kiting and the power of crits and vision. Most of the 450 champs are designed to be easy enough to learn, but not op enough to be super viable in high elos.

Most 450 IP champs have been FotM at some stage.
The assassin meta is pretty much over now, and it's moved onto more sustained burst mages, the type of champs who dominate assassins in mid lane.
But if rito did that, then Ashe would be really op considering she can slow and stun people
When you're forced to mid but only know how to ADC.

Ashe is rather anti-kite while being kite heavy herself.

She dominates very few ADCs in lane, but once out of the laning phase she destroys most brawlers who lack in reliable gap closers.
Often she can ruin a tanks day as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Klavinmour,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=dnTP3BX1,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-01-16T04:45:10.089+0000)

> She dominates very few ADCs in lane, but once out of the laning phase she destroys most brawlers who lack in reliable gap closers.
> Often she can ruin a tanks day as well.

I once kited a Teemo who was full HP while I was at half and ended up killing him. You can literally survive (and potentially kill) Anti-ADC champions as Ashe.

I counterpick Vayne with it.

Vayne is vulnerable to harass early, and Hard CC late. Both of which Ashe provides with Volley + 600 Range, and Enchanted Crystal Arrow respectively.

She's also great in any team comp where you lack Hard Engage or vision control.
